channel.title: PIPING HOT DATA
channel.description: The personsal website of Shannon Pileggi

item.title: Personal R Administration on Windows
item.dc:creator: Shannon Pileggi
item.description:
TL;DR

Type Item Code Location
Home ?? Sys.getenv("HOME"), Sys.getenv("R_User") C:\Users\pileggis\OneDrive - Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center\Documents
Home ?? fs::path_home_r() C:\Users\pileggis\OneDrive - Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center\Documents
Home ?? fs::path_home() C:\Users\pileggis
Software R R.home(), Sys.getenv("R_HOME") C:\PROGRA~1\R\R-41~1.2
Software RStudio NA C:\Program Files\RStudio
Software R packages .libPaths() "C:\Program Files\R\R-4.1.1\library" "C:\Program Files\R\R-4.1.2\library"
Software Rtools NA C:\rtools40
Software Git NA C:\Program Files\Git
Configuration .gitconfig usethis::edit_git_config() C:\Users\pileggis\.gitconfig
Configuration .Renviron usethis::edit_r_environ() C:\Users\pileggis\OneDrive - Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center\Documents\.Renviron
Configuration .Rprofile usethis::edit_r_profile() C:\Users\pileggis\OneDrive - Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center\Documents\.Rprofile
Configuration destination directory in .Rprofile: options(usethis.destdir = "X/X") C:\Users\pileggis\Documents\gh-personal"
Configuration shrtcts shrtcts::locate_shortcuts_source() NA

Background

Error: Could not find addins.json in the usual places. You may need to manually create a new keyboard shortcut (use RStudio's Tools menu) first.
[shrtcts] Could not find .shrtcts.R or .shrtcts.yaml in C:\Users\pileggis\AppData\Roaming/shrtcts/shrtcts, C:/Users/pileggis/OneDrive - Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center/Documents/.config or C:/Users/pileggis/OneDrive - Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center/Documents

Windows basics

Do I have administrator rights?

When I received my new work laptop, I did not have administrator rights. This made it challenging to install things where ever and whenever I needed to configure R and git in a developer environment.

I submitted many IT tickets, cajoled, and pleaded. Eventually, I was granted certain permissions that allow me to work independently.

I explored the methods listed in How to Check If I Have Administrator Rights in Windows 10 and I can confirm that I still do not have full ‚Äúadministrator rights‚Äù on my computer, but rather I was granted with some sort of partial rights that let me get by.

From Omar Chua. provisioning is different on Flex laptops vs Domain accounts Flex laptops are Azure AD based So it looks like Admin Rights are enable or disable using a cloud group for the azure devices (flex laptops) you will not see indication from your actual account as the provisioning is done through the flex device

Recommended Windows settings

When getting started with a Windows computer, I recommend changing default settings such that:

  1. Display the full path in the title bar
  2. Show hidden files, folders, and drives
  3. Hide extension for known file types
tweetrmd::include_tweet("https://twitter.com/PipingHotData/status/1450494168900509697")

Some Windows ü™ü defaults I always change on a new computerüíªüßê

Do you have other defaults you change on Windows?

gotta love the switcheroos between hide/display & check/uncheck pic.twitter.com/X1XZ24ltz1

— Shannon Pileggi (@PipingHotData) October 19, 2021

Intial home paths

I explored how R defines my home directories.

R installation

From the R.home() help file:

The R home directory is the top-level directory of the R installation being run.

R.home()

"C:/PROGRA~1/R/R-41~1.2"

The R home directory is often referred to as R_HOME, and is the value of an environment variable of that name in an R session.

Sys.getenv("R_HOME")

"C:/PROGRA~1/R/R-41~1.2"

Thing 2

Sys.getenv("HOME")

"C:/Users/pileggis/OneDrive - Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center/Documents"

Sys.getenv("R_User")

"C:/Users/pileggis/OneDrive - Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center/Documents"

Thing 3

fs::path_home()

C:/Users/pileggis

fs::path_home_r()

C:/Users/pileggis/OneDrive - Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center/Documents

.Rprofile

The usethis package can open your R profile for editing with usethis::edit_r_profile(), and you don‚Äôt need to necessarily know where it lives.

But I still want to know. The RStudio article Managing R with .Rprofile, .Renviron, Rprofile.site, Renviron.site, rsession.conf, and repos.conf by Alex Gold says that the ‚ÄúUser-level .Rprofile files live in the base of the user‚Äôs home directory.‚Äù

For me, that means

C:\Users\pileggis\OneDrive - Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center\Documents\.Rprofile

.Renviron

usethis::edit_r_environ()

R_LIBS_USER = ‚ÄúC:/Program Files/R/R-4.1.1/library‚Äù

R package installation

How to Set Your Default Package Install Location in R

.libPaths()

"C:/Program Files/R/R-4.1.1/library" "C:/Program Files/R/R-4.1.2/library"

Rtools

Rtools is‚Ä¶

"C:\rtools40"

Git installation

Program files

As recommended in Happy Git with R, git is installed at

C:\Program Files\Git

.gitconfig

You can quickly open your .gitconfig file for editing with usethis::edit_git_config(). My .gitconfig file lives at:

"C:\Users\pileggis\.gitconfig"

Other modifications

in .Rprofile

options(usethis.destdir = "C:/Users/pileggis/Documents/gh-personal")
